thread.title: Airbus Group SE: Strong Q4 Deliveries and Inventory Management Support Buy Rating
thread.title_full: Airbus Group SE: Strong Q4 Deliveries and Inventory Management Support Buy Rating

author: Tipranks
title: Airbus Group SE: Strong Q4 Deliveries and Inventory Management Support Buy Rating
text:
Airbus Group SE: Strong Q4 Deliveries and Inventory Management Support Buy Rating
Airbus Group SE ([EADSF](https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/eadsf?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral) – [Research Report](https://www.tipranks.com/subscribe/research-report/?symbol=eadsf&ref=MCO_STOCK&refersTo=&merge=Markets&utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral)), the Industrials sector company, was revisited by a Wall Street analyst today. Analyst [Chloe Lemaire](https://www.tipranks.com/experts/analysts/chloe-lemaire?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral) from Jefferies maintained a Buy rating on the stock and has a €170.00 price target.
Stay Ahead of the Market:

[Top Smart Score Stocks](https://www.tipranks.com/screener/top-smart-score-stocks?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral) - Filter, analyze, and streamline your search for investment opportunities using
[Tipranks' Stock Screener](https://www.tipranks.com/screener/stocks?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral)
Chloe Lemaire’s rating is based on several positive factors reflecting Airbus Group SE’s performance and prospects. The company reported December deliveries of 123 aircraft, marking a 10% increase year-over-year, which suggests a strong finish to the fourth quarter. Despite missing the full-year delivery target of 770 slightly, the results align with expectations reported by Reuters, showcasing a robust product mix, particularly with the notable increase in A321 deliveries.
Additionally, while gross orders were softer than usual in December, the reduction in inventory levels is expected to contribute positively to the company’s free cash flow in the fourth quarter. The combination of increased deliveries, a solid product mix, and improved inventory management underpins the optimistic outlook and supports the Buy rating for Airbus Group SE.

Airbus Group SE (EADSF) Company Description:
Airbus SE engages in the design, manufacture, delivery, and provision of aerospace products, space, and related services. It operates through the following segments: Airbus Commercial Aircraft; Airbus Helicopters; and Airbus Defence and Space. The Airbus Commercial Aircraft segment develops, manufactures, markets, and sells commercial jet aircrafts; and offers aircraft conversion and related services. The Airbus Helicopters segment deals with the development, manufacture, marketing, and sale of civil and military helicopters. The Airbus Defence and Space segment covers systems and services in the field of defence and space for governments, institutions, and commercial customers. The company was founded on December 29, 1998 and is headquartered in Leiden, the Netherlands.
